avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches are hardly possible in gullies and bowls.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, with a loosely-packed surface with surface hoar and faceted crystals

tendency.highlights: No significant change expected in avalanche danger levels

weatherForecast.comment: On Tuesday, repeated clouds will move in from the south, the peaks will often be shrouded in fog. Initially, snowfall in Upper Carinthia. Bright intervals intermittently in the Gurktal Alps to Koralpe. In the afternoon, clouds will gradually begin to disperse. Light to moderate W/NW winds. At 1000m: +4 degrees; at 2000m: -2 degrees. Source: Geosphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Freshly generated snowdrift accumulations are small-sized yet still often prone to triggering, particularly in gullies and bowls along the Salzburg border, such danger zones are easy to recognize. Avalanches can in isolated cases fracture down to more deeply embedded layers in the old snopwack and then grow to medium size.  On shady slopes and in high alpine zones the likelihood of triggering is higher.

snowpackStructure.comment: Freshly generated and older snowdrift accumulations lie deposited particularly above 2400m were depositedon W/N/E facing slopes. More deeply embedded inside the old snowpack are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers, esp. on shady wind-protected slopes. Clear skies are forecast, with low temperatures and low air moisture. Thus, the snowpack will expansively metamorphose during the nocturnal hours. The snowpack is highly diverse even over small areas.

tendency.highlights: No significant change anticiated  in avalanche danger

weatherForecast.comment: On Tuesday, repeated clouds will move in from the south, the peaks will often be shrouded in fog. Initially, snowfall in Upper Carinthia. Bright intervals intermittently in the Gurktal Alps to Koralpe. In the afternoon, clouds will gradually begin to disperse. Light to moderate W/NW winds. At 1000m: +4 degrees; at 2000m: -2 degrees. Source: Geosphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Older snowdrift accumulations are generally small-sized, triggerable only in isolated cases, esp.on wind-protected shady slopes above 2000m, esp. in transitions into gullies and bowls and at the foot of rocky cliffs and behind protruberances in the landscape.  Apart from the risks of being buried in snow masses, the danger of being swept along and forced to take a fall require consideration.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated danger zones in gullies and bowls

snowpackStructure.comment: The older snowdrifts blanket a weak old snowpack. The snowpack is highly diverse even over small areas. Only little snow on the ground from region to region below 1600m. Clear nighttime skies are forecast, with low temperatures and low air moisture. Thus, the snowpack will expansively metamorphose during the nocturnal hours. The snowpack is highly diverse even over small areas. Below 1600m very little snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: No significant change in avalanche danger levels expected

weatherForecast.comment: Intermittently dense clouds moving in during the afternoon from the south, occasional bright spells possible, mostly dry. Southerly winds will be moderate-strength, stronger only in summit zones. At 3000m: -7 degrees; at 2000m: -1 degree. Source: GeoSphere Austria

customData.generalHeadline: Caution: snowdrifts. Little snow on the ground regionally.
